intro: Hieracium ragusinoides, commonly known as the Ragusan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium ragusinoides is often found in southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in temperate climates.
